availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Americus V. Carlisle (provost marshall, Carroll county)

body.p: Carroll County, Kentucky, attorney and deputy provost marshal. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Carlisle and Acenith P. Carlisle. Attorney in Carroll County in 1860. Deputy provost marshal of Carroll County during the Civil War. Killed at the hands of Quantrill's guerrillas near Carrollton, Kentucky, in February 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll, District 2, p. 68.
“Civil War Reports,” The Madison Daily Courier, February 3, 1865.
Richard D. Sears, Camp Nelson, Kentucky: A Civil War History (Lexington: University of Kentucky Press, 2002), p. 74.
